subject: Matrix_row()
content: I am getting a warning from the compiler that "implicit conversion loses integer precision: 'long' to 'int'" whenever I try performing pointer arithmetic on mat->data and ptr together.. . Can this simply be solved by static casting to int, or will this cause problems?. . Thanks.
i_answer: It's tough to know for sure without seeing the code, but it seems like static casting should solve the issue.

subject: For tests, are we allowed to use the -> operator?
content: I know in the specs it says this:. . **In particular, no function other than `Matrix_row`, `Matrix_column`, and the two versions of `Matrix_at` should access the `data` member directly.**. . Does this apply to writing tests as well? Or are we allowed to directly compare the output Matrix's fields to the expected values? In particular, I wanted to take a look at `mat->height`, `mat->width`, and `mat->data`.. . Thank you!
i_answer: This does apply to the tests. Respecting the interface is a very important part of this class in general. However, this isn't a major issue as some of the functions you have implemented will do the same thing! For instance, calling Matrix_height(mat) should return the exact same value as calling mat->height.

subject: Matrix_column and Matrix_row pointer confusion
content: Hello, quick question about the pointer being passed as the parameter for both functions. Do they contain a value from the Matrix or do they contain an address that points to a value within the matrix? . . If it contains an address, how would I use it to find the row and column of the element it points to?
i_answer: They contain an address that points to a value within the matrix. Think about how you can use the *mat with the *ptr to find the location. Remember that although we want the matrix to be 2D, underneath the hood it is actually just a 1D array. If I want to represent or pass through an array as a ptr, where in the array is that ptr actually pointing to?. . Hopefully that helps out a little bit.

subject: Should matrix functions be expected to deal with doubles?
content: Will test cases ever initialize a matrix having a double for the row/column values? Wondering if I need to find a way around this or if the test cases will only create matrices with whole value parameters?. . edit : would this be an example of finding a bug?? from my understanding we should write multiple test cases for each function, some of which will fail meaning they've encountered a possible bug. is this an example of a test case we would want to fail?
i_answer: Because the two parameters for Matrix_init are ints, you can assume that anytime the test cases initialize a matrix it will be with integers, not doubles.

content: We are having trouble testing matrix max because right now the only two values we can initialize the matrix with are the fill and border values and we want to test our function on more diverse values. Is there a way to fill our matrix with many different numbers so we can more properly test max?

subject: Matrix_row()/col
content: Hello,. . I am really confused on how to approach Matrix_row()/col. I understand that we have to do pointer arithmetic to get the index of the number, but I do not know how to get the row/col without a for loop approach. Any type of help would be appreciated. Thanks :)

Indices 0-4 are in row 0, indices 5-9 are in row 1, etc. So once you have the index of the value you want (let's say index 6), how can divison/mod and the width help you get the row/col?

Your intuition for using the Image_init function seems reasonable, and you would need to loop through and copy each element as the new image you are copying into is not the same size as the original image before seam removal.. . This is a great question, and I think other students could benefit from seeing it. If you feel comfortable, feel free to make it public! You can still choose to keep it anonymous. Hope this helps!

subject: matrix_col / row
content: in these functions what is the ptr that is passed. is it a number in element, an address ect ?
i_answer: It is an address that points to a number inside of the matrix. Think about how you could use the ptr address with the address to the matrix to find the row/col of the number pointed to.

subject: How to test Image_print()
content: I'm trying to test my Matrix_print function in the test file by declaring and initializing a Matrix. I respected the interface by using Matrix_init(), but how can I efficiently fill the matrix with random numbers I create without doing "Matrix testMatrix = {2, 2, {numbers I want}};" and breaking the interface? Would I have to use the Matrix_at() function for every array value I input? I feel like that's just inefficient.
i_answer: One good way to do this would be to use Matrix_at() in a double for loop (one loop for row, one for column). You could then utilize the rand() function in C++ (https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/numeric/random/rand) to fill in numbers or you could declare a vector of the matrix you want (in 1D form) and index that vector inside of your double for loop. There are many other options on what type of numbers you could put in your matrix, and I encourage you to think about some of the edge cases.. . There's some other ways that I can think of off the top of my head, but they'll all be equally tedious. However, I would keep in mind that a good test case isn't always large and should be testing one singular part of your program/function.. . Hopefully that clears up some of your confusion.

subject: Matrix_init help
content: From my understanding, *mat is an object/pointer. I am confused on how to modify *mat. Also I am unsure how to initialize the matrix without using variable length arrays.
i_answer: Remember that you can use the arrow operator (->) on "mat" to access any of the Matrix functions or member variables. For instance, if there was a name variable on Matrix, you could set the name in matrix_init by writing "mat->name = "Joe".

subject: function test_find_seam
content: . Hi, mytest_find_seam function in processing_public_tests.cpp failed,but I can't figure out which function could be the source of the failure. Meanwhile, since the write_seam is outputing,and load_seam is inputing, how could those two arrays be equal??
i_answer: All this function is doing is comparing your seam to the seam we're expecting. We're outputting your seam to a file and reading in our seam from a file, the function then compares those two.. . You can check the output file that has your seam and compare it to our file to see what might be going on, otherwise I suggest using your debugger to figure out what's going wrong.

subject: Matrix_Print
content: I am trying to create a copy of the pointer that points to the beginning of Matrix->data. My IDE let's me do this if the Matrix variable is not constant, but throws an error when it is constant.. I'm guessing that means I'm somehow trying to modify the const variable, but I don't understand how that would be the case.. . trying to do something like . . void function(const Matrix *m) {. .     int *ptr = m->data;. }. . and getting error: "a value of type "const int \*" cannot be used to initialize an entity of type "int \*"
i_answer: in this case, m is a "pointer to const", meaning that whatever m is pointing to cannot be modified (including the data array). You could declare it as a const int * to fix this. What the student suggested actually shouldn't work, because &(m->data) will give you a pointer to the whole data array, and dereferencing this pointer will give you the array, which decays to the address of the first element.

subject: Question regarding computer memory
content: Am I allowed to assume all computers will allocate 4 bytes of memory for each int object when writing Matrix_row and Matrix_column, or is there another way?. .
i_answer: This is a great consideration! However, C++ is smart enough to recognize the type of pointer that is being used (in this case an int *), and will consider the size of the specified type when doing pointer arithmetic. In other words, you wouldn't have to divide by 4 as it is taken into account when performing "ptr - (mat->data)". . So if ptr is at address 1000 and you run ptr++, if the ptr is an int ptr it will go to address 1004, not 1001. Again, good thought but sometimes C++ will do the hard work for us.

subject: resize.cpp Error Checking with multiple errors
content: The guidelines for resize.cpp have some requirements on how the program does CLI argument error checking, but I'm not entirely sure on what to do if multiple errors occur—and if that won't happen in testcases so it doesn't matter, great! Specifically, what if a dimension is invalid and opening a file fails? More specifically, validating the maximum size requires reading the input file (in which case I'd assume we should print the error message for opening it if it fails), but does it matter if the output file is error-checked before the dimensions are validated for their maximum size?
i_answer: If there is multiple errors, your program should focus on the one that happens first. It does not matter if the output file is error checked before the dimensions are validated. We suggest you error check the dimensions first, and if one of those is triggered, the program will end and you don't have to worry about the others.

subject: How to initialize seam array for Project 2 Processing.cpp
content: I've been working on Processing.cpp for Project 2, but I am stuck on the seam_carve_width function because it will not compile, due to my array initialization for seam. For some reason, I cannot put in a variable length, but I don't understand how else I can generate the size for the seam. . .
i_answer: As a rule in c++, you cannot initialize arrays with variable as length. This is because the compiler needs to allocate the correct amount of memory at compile time (before any of the code is run). You'll have to pick a constant to initialize your array length, something large enough that any array we try will fit. . Check the spec to see what the largest valid array length can be for this project.

subject: Unresolved Symbol from Visual Studio
content: Hi, I am getting a list of error messages from Visual Studio that prevented me from running the debugger, but the code runs on the command line if I make a .exe file, and it runs on Autograder. Can anyone help me how to resolve the problem so I can use the debugger? Thank you for all the help.. (By the way, it appeared on p1 as well, but since it is easy enough, I was using the pencil to trace the data and finished it, but I think I have to use the debugger for the ongoing projects).
i_answer: The LNK2019 error can occur when a declaration exists in a header file, but no matching definition is implemented. I would check your .h and .cpp files to make sure each function that has a declaration also has an implementation or a function stub.

subject: what does data do? i dont get its purpose or function
i_answer: If you are referring to the member called "data" in the Matrix struct, it is an array storing the integers in a Matrix.. . The data array is the underlying implementation of how integers are stored in the Matrix object, while the 2D Matrix is the interface that users of the Matrix see.. . For example, the Matrix represented below to the left has an underlying "data" array as shown below to the right.. . [1, 2, 3,. 4, 5, 6,        ----->     [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9]. 7, 8, 9]

content: If I want to access for the element in row p and column q, can I use mat->data[p * q] or use mat->data[p*width+q] to access for it?

subject: For Matrix_init(), are we supposed to resize mat->data as well?
content: Hi, so I was wondering if we were supposed to change the actual size of the underlying array as well, which has a size of 500*500 by default. My initial guess says yes, but I wasn't sure because the public test cases weren't testing for them.. . Thank you!
i_answer: If you look at the EFFECTS clause of Matrix_init() in the Matrix.h file, it says. "Initializes *mat as a Matrix with the given width and height.". This is all you need to do : ). . Every matrix created will have an underlying unchanging data array of size 500*500

subject: How to use mat in the Matrix_ init function
content: My partner and I are having trouble understanding how to use the mat variable in the Matrix_init function. We tried to make a matrix using an array, but we don't know how to make mat point to that matrix. Some guidance would be appreciated. Here is our code:. . .      . .
i_answer: I would suggest taking another look at how the Matrix struct is defined in `Matrix.h`. Here, you can see that there are three member variables (`width`, `heigh`t & `data`) where `data` is a 2D array already allocated to `MAX_MATRIX_WIDTH` by `MAX_MATRIX_HEIGHT` dimensions. In `Matrix_init`, you are passed a pointer to a Matrix where your job is to "Initialize \*mat as a Matrix with the given width and height." Given that `data` is already initialized, you just have to handle the other member variables. . . Feel free to follow-up with clarifications!

subject: How to check the matrix is a valid matrix
content: In the requirement, it says mat points to a valid Matrix. I know that it is good to write assert to check the requirement. But how can we check that?
i_answer: Hello! . . You're right! Using assert statements to check the conditions in the REQUIRES clause is a great practice. However, some conditions like whether mat points to a valid matrix cannot be checked using assert statements : ). . I have attached a line from the "Assertions" subsection of the "Matrix Module" in the specification (https://eecs280staff.github.io/p2-cv/#assertions):. . " Of course, you can’t assert every single thing in the REQUIRES clause. Some of them can’t possibly be checked. For example, you can’t check that a pointer points to a valid Matrix (i.e. one that has been initialized). ". . Hope this helps!

subject: SSH Keys setup
content: Hello, I wanted to generate SSH keys, but the outcome is different comparing to the tutorial. It starts with SHA256 instead of ssh-rsa, ssh-dss, ecdsa-sha2-nistp256, ecdsa-sha2-nistp384, ecdsa-sha2-nistp521, ssh-ed25519, sk-ecdsa-sha2-nistp256@openssh.com, or sk-ssh-ed25519@openssh.com. What should I do next? By the way, it says "Publicly visible private SSH keys can compromise your system." What does this mean and do I need to make any changes?
i_answer: The sequence of characters following "SHA256" is your key's fingerprint, which is different than the key itself. If you want to see the actual key, cd into your .ssh directory, and run the command cat id_ed25519.pub. Just make sure you don't share your private key and you should be fine

subject: Private test grading
content: Before the deadline my score was 9/9 and all the functions passed the test on my computer. But I got marked down with some of my functions in the private test for the final grade. So, I want to know how us the private test section graded and what to look for in order to get full points for my private tests for the future projects. Does it mean that my test cases weren’t able to expose some of the bugs?
i_answer: We test a wide array of inputs in order to see how resilient your program is and if it works as promised. In order to pass the private test cases you will need to think creatively about what valid edge cases might be able to break the types of functions or programs you are implementing and writing tests that handle those cases. If you are not passing all the privates it means that your test cases were likely not able to expose those bugs (since they were found in your program).

subject: Matrix row question
content: How are we supposed to do this function if we are not allowed to use a loop? The spec says these functions (row and col) should not use a loop. . . also what if there is more than one number in the array. ex: two 5s in different rows. what would we return then
i_answer: Instead of using a loop to find the index, think about how we have a pointer as a parameter in the function which we can use to help find the index (pointer arithmetic). A good example of this in use would be slide 10 on the lab 3 slides. This finds the index.. . Then, you must figure out which row it may be in. Something else you may need to help understand which row or column it should be in is the example 5x3 array in the spec. Specifically how the indexes fit with the rows and columns those elements are in. Since it is a 1-D array, the rows and columns are all fit into one array.. . I found this easier to find when I wrote Matrix_column before Matrix_row.

subject: matrix_print

However, I would suggest taking a look at the other matrix functions you will implement. Is there anything you could use to get a pointer to a specific element in the matrix?

subject: Issues compiling
content: My Xcode project fails to build and gives me 2 errors: "error build: 50 duplicate symbols for architecture arm64" and "warning build: no rule to process file '/Users/sofiavalb/Desktop/eecs280/p2-cv/Makefile' of type 'sourcecode.make' for architecture 'arm64'". What could I do to fix this?
i_answer: Typically duplicate symbols occur when your compile sources are not configured correctly to run in XCode or you have unnecessary #includes. To fix this, I would first refer to this section of the setup guide which walks through how you configured compile sources in P1. Depending on what file you are trying to run, you just have to add the necessary files!As for the Makefile warning, this is likely also caused by your compile sources not being configured correctly. Following the same steps as before, double check that your Makefile is not listed as a compile source.. . Feel free to follow-up if you need any further clarification!

subject: How do we use the ostream?
content: Do we have to use Matrix_print to write to a file? Is it enough to just print the result to the console?
i_answer: Given an ostream `os`, you can use it in the same way that you would use `cout` or `ofstream`. So to print to an `ostream` called `os`, you just do something like. ```. os << "this is printed to the ostream";. ```

subject: Somewhat lost on Image_init(Image* img, std::istream& is)
content: I am unfortunately almost completely lost on this implementation. How should we read an image in ppm? Would anyone give a hint?
i_answer: Recall the format of a ppm file: https://eecs280staff.github.io/p2-cv/#ppm-format. . Pretend that `is` is just typical user input like `cin`, and use it in that way.. . To get the "P3" at the top, you can do `is >> blah;` where `blah` is some string variable. Then, you can continue reading in everything else (skipping whitespace) with `is >> `.

subject: testing matrix.cpp
content: I am little confused as to how to design my tests in Matrix_tests.cpp. Could someone explain the TEST(<method name>) syntax and how all of the test methods defined in this way are automatically ran without being explicitly called when compiling and running Matrix_tests.cpp?. . Also, could someone describe the purpose of the unit_tests_framework.h file? Any help would be appreciated, thanks!
i_answer: Hello! . . Referring to slides 15 and 16 in lab 3 (https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/13a7U67orAdlr05_EtFnOpkdutj-HqEBr_1swx9OTB7s/edit?usp=sharing) will be helpful!. . Mentally, you can view TEST(<method name>) as a function named <method name>. Against this backdrop, each TEST(<method name>) you write corresponds to a function named <method name>.. . When you write TEST_MAIN() in the test file, you can view it as an int main function that calls all the functions corresponding to TEST functions. . . You need to ensure you import unit_tests_framework.h as a header file to be able to use TEST(<method name>) as the students' answer suggests : )

subject: Question regarding setup for project 2
content: I'm looking at the project 2 spec and at the Setup section ("Commit and submit" specifically), it says to "submit the code you have to the autograder. It's best to find out early if there’s a mismatch between the autograder and your local development environment". . . When I submit to the autograder and get the results, what exactly am I trying to look for? Whether the code compiles? What would I see if there was a mismatch?
i_answer: What this part of the spec is referring to is that some development environments may overlook certain issues that CAEN / the autograder will flag as problematic. For instance, your IDE may not warn you if you are having memory errors but submitting to the autograder certainly will. Essentially we are just promoting the idea of submitting early so that if something looks right on your local computer but has problems in the autograder, you catch this early.

subject: do we need to make a  arrays_tests.cpp
content: what file should i start implementing first?
i_answer: You only need the files in the starter code, but you are free to create more files for testing.. . Follow the p2 spec in order, the first portion of the project you want to look into is the matrix module. But of course, make sure to do the setup tutorial before getting started.

subject: where do i start for project 2
content: what file should i start implementing first?
i_answer: It would make the most sense to do the Matrix file first since the Image file builds off of the Matrix implementation. The main/driver file is usually implemented last. But at the end of the day, it's up to you as there is no correct order to implement it.

content: I keep getting stuck on the "git push -u origin main" part of the setup. When I put that into my terminal, it says ".  ! [rejected]        main -> main (fetch first). error: failed to push some refs to 'https://gitlab.eecs.umich.edu/valbuena/p1-cv.git'. hint: Updates were rejected because the remote contains work that you do. hint: not have locally. This is usually caused by another repository pushing. hint: to the same ref. You may want to first integrate the remote changes. hint: (e.g., 'git pull ...') before pushing again.. hint: See the 'Note about fast-forwards' in 'git push --help' for details.". I already tried to pull but it did nothing. How can I fix this?
i_answer: I had the same issue and before I ran "git pull origin main" I ran "git config pull.rebase true" and together the commands fixed it for me

subject: variable length array
content: I wrote in void Matrix_init():. .   const int size = width * height;.   int data[size] = {0};. . . but when I tried to compile it, there is an error says:. error: ISO C++ forbids variable length array ‘data’ [-Werror=vla]. . What can I do?
i_answer: Since width and height can change depending on user input, the value of size can change from run to run. C++ forbids this. In order to make an array, you must have a constant int size that's the same for every run of the program.

subject: P2 Allowed to use "using namespace std"?
content: Are we allowed to include "using namespace std" at the top of our Matrix.cpp file? Or should I just do std:: next to everything (for example, std::cout)?
i_answer: To augment the student answer, it's considered bad practice to include "using namespace <anything>" in a .h file (since then if someone down the road includes your library, you are forcing them to use that namespace which could cause naming conflicts). Other than that, you should feel free to to include that statement in any .cpp file.

Are we supposed to use specific functions like getLine from the istream? I have ideas about how to process the file, but I'm just really confused on how to actually obtain it from istream.
i_answer: If you imagine the `istream` to just be `cin`, it acts in the same way as though you were reading the file from user input. Does that answer your question?

subject: Project 2 FAQ
content: Refer to this post for Frequently Asked Questions regarding Project 2. Project 2 is due Wednesday, September 28th at 8pm.  Please keep the followups related to questions in this post only.. . Spec is here. . Resize GUI repository (you can use this to easily try your resize code on other images!): https://github.com/oalejel/resize-GUI. Write clear code! This is especially important for this project, remember:Matrix width = # of columnsMatrix height = # of rowsInstead of using variables like "i" and "j" in your for-loops, consider using "row" and "col" so you don't get confused!Q: Am I required to use traversal by pointer?A: No. You are allowed to, but not required to use traversal by pointer in this project. You should choose to traverse by index/pointer based on what makes sense to you logically.Q: My program takes a couple minutes or more to run. Is this expected? A: Yes, but not too long - your program should run in under 30 seconds. Double check that you're not looping unnecessarily or calling an inefficient function within a loop. Perf is also a helpful tool for improving efficiency! https://eecs280staff.github.io/p2-cv/#appendix-b-perf-tutorialQ: Rotate left is failing, even though it was provided. Is there an error in the provided function? A: Rotate left calls several student implemented image functions, which can cause errors in rotate left.Q: Why do I have to write functions like Matrix_width? Couldn't I just use matrix->width directly?A: Unless you're implementing a Matrix function, this is generally considered really poor design! We actually consider this incorrect behavior, even if you get the right results, so please make sure you use the right function. Even if it's just Matrix_width and Matrix_height, whenever you're not writing Matrix functions, go through the interface - the same goes for Image as well.Q: Do I have to respect the interface when writing tests?A: Yes, tests should always respect the interface! In the real world, this means you can reuse tests when changing the implementation to make sure that you haven't also changed the interface, such that you can avoid updating the code everywhere the interface is used!Q: How can I test Matrix_at without breaking the interface?A: When thinking of unit testing, you should think in units as behavior instead of units as functions, because it is common to have functions like Matrix_at that solely rely on the underlying implementation. When testing Matrix_at, we really want to test the behavior of setting and retrieving independent values reliably from our matrix. For example, you could test that setting a value at (0,1) doesn't modify the value at (1,0) or other similar variations of this.Q: What does it mean for the column start to be inclusive and the column end to be exclusive? A: This means that when looking for the min value, you should consider the column start but not column end. For example, if my column start was 2 and my column end was 5, I would consider columns 2,3, and 4, but not 5. Q: Why am I failing crabster but passing dog and horses?A: Crabster tends to catch more edge cases. Be sure that in all cases you're checking the correct columns when you compute the energy, cost, and seam.. Q: One of my processing test is failing, but when I print out the output it matches the correct file. A: Double check your image init. If you read in the correct image incorrectly, then Image_equal will fail even if you've processed the image correctly.. . Q: I am missing some test cases. What other tests should I write to catch the test cases?. A: Sorry! We don't share what test cases the AG is looking for. The best advice we can give it to brainstorm more edge cases. . . Q: I'm trying to run processing_public_test.cpp/resize.cpp on XCode, and Xcode is saying that it's unable to open dog.ppm/crabster.ppm/horses.ppm.. A: You need to update XCode's custom working directory: https://eecs280staff.github.io/p1-stats/setup_xcode.html#run. Happy coding!

subject: SSH keys Gitlab - permission denied
content: I have been following the steps on the [GitLab SSH page](https://gitlab.eecs.umich.edu/help/user/ssh.md) to set up SSH keys, but when trying to connect to the server, it has denied my requests:. . ```. $ ssh -T waning@gitlab.eecs.umich.edu. waning@gitlab.eecs.umich.edu: Permission denied (publickey,password).. ```. . I have added. ```. Host gitlab.eecs.umich.edu.   PreferredAuthentications publickey.   IdentityFile ~/.ssh/id_ed25519. ```. to my `~/.ssh/config file` (using WSL Ubuntu). What am I doing wrong here?
i_answer: so uh you don't use your uniqname when trying to ssh, it should be. ```. ssh -T git@gitlab.eecs.umich.edu. ```. instead. great to figure out minutes after posting the question
